page.title: 14CUSTOMS AROUND BALLINDALLOCH
page.content: The custom of 'Feet-Washing'occurs before a wedding,and is inflicted on the bridegroom. His friends cover him in filthy,sticky substances like treacle,sump oil,feathers etc. Sometimes the bride suffers the same rough treatment. Most older houses have a rowan tree in their garden as this tree was believed in the past to ward off evil spirits. The prophecy that one day the"kirk o' Invera'an would gang doon Spey fu'o'folk"looked as if it might come true in the Great Floods of 1829.
